answers.answer: Does "No thyroid" mean you had your thyroid removed or does it mean you weren't on medication in Dec 2012?Looks like you simply need an increase in your Armour dosage.  30 mg is a very small dosage.  Just because labs are "in range" doesn't mean they are good for you.  Both your FT3 and FT4 are too low in the ranges; however, it should be noted that many people on desiccated hormones, have lower FT4.FT3 is the one to be most concerned about, because that's the hormone that's actually used by individual cells and it corresponds with symptoms, while TSH and FT4 do not.Do you know if you have Hashimoto's Thyroiditis?

Sorry, "no thyroid" means I wasn't on thyroid meds at the time. Thank you for the very good information. My Dr. reluctantly upped it from 30mg a day to 60mg. I'm hoping this helps. No one has mentioned Hashi to me. How can you tell if it is?
You have to get antibody tests - Thyroid Peroxidase Antibodies (TPOab) and Thyroglobulin Antibodies (TGab) - you need them both, since some of us have one or the other, while some of us have both.
Thank you Barb, I'm writing this down to tell the Dr. I appreciate it!
If you have other questions, don't hesitate to ask.

question: These have been my numbers. I am fairy new to this and was wondering why my FT4 isn't changing. Still not feeling well, dry hair falling out, very sleepy and feel like I'm dragging. I also have type2 diabetes and my blood sugars are not doing well (A1c is going up 9.6) no matter if I eat or not. So frustrating.Normal range is the same for all.3/27/14  upped Armour to 30mg am/30mg pmTSH  2.141  (0.350-5.00)FT3  2.6      (2.2-4.0)FT4  1.0      (0.80-1.5)5/1/13  Armour 15mg am/15mg pmTSH 1.87  (0.350-5.00)FT3 2.7     (2.2-4.0)FT4 1.0     (0.80-1.5)2/21/13  Armour 15mg am/15mg pmTSH 2.3FT3 2.6FT4 1.012/10/12 No thyriodTSH 1.736FT3 2.3FT4 0.9
title: Why isn't my FT4 moving?
